Game

Class Heart

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • Game.MoveableCharacter
            • Game.Sprite
              • Game.Heart
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable

    public class Heart
extends Sprite
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class represents a heart. The number of hearts equals to the number of health each player has left.
    Author:
    Sitton
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • determineXPosition

        public static int determineXPosition(Player owner,
                                     int index)
        This method determines the x position of an heart according to its owner and its index
        Parameters:
        owner - - the owner of the heart
        index - -the index of the heart
        Returns:
        - the x position of an heart

      • run

        public void run()
        This method runs as long as the owner is not dead.
        It checks the owner's health and remove the correct heart if the player has lost health from the last check
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • removeSprite

        public void removeSprite()
        Removes a sprite form the Sprite.existingSprites ArrayList

        In addition, this sets the costume constants of the heart to 1 in order to remove it from the screen
        Overrides:
        removeSprite in class Sprite
        See Also:
        Sprite.getExistingSprites()
